WRITING.TEXT: Hi! I #8217;m 27 and have recently decided to TTC with my husband (36). We #8217;ve been together 3 years and married for 1. I just stopped my HBC pills literally two days ago after 9 years on it and I get to see him again in just under 11 days (but who #8217;s counting?) because my work makes me travel... unfortunate during a pandemic, I know. I am originally from the SE US but not living there currently. I #8217;m a little paranoid about giving personal deets because I also work in a small field and a BFP will definitely have a major impact on my job - though luckily my husband has a very normal and steady job so that isn #8217;t a problem at least. I #8217;ve never TTC or been pregnant before. I had a sort of weird complex about it for a while because I #8217;m adopted and was the product of a one-night-stand, but ever since I found Mr. Right my feelings changed significantly. We had wanted kids from the beginning, but I just recently got settled into my work and a lot of the projects from here on out are going to be postponed because... yeah, pandemic. We #8217;re happy and stable and have a pretty roomy condo so we felt in our gut it was the right time to begin. I #8217;m cramping a lot right now so I #8217;m waiting on the post-BC spotting any day. Also feeling greasy-faced and having some mood swings. Ahh, to feel like I #8217;m a teenager again lmao. But I just started some prenatal vitamins and am both excited and nervous for the road ahead! Oh, and my username is a lame pun on a Nina Simone song because I was not feeling creative at the time I made this account.

Maaaaan withdrawal bleeding after stopping HBC really really sucks. I was expecting some spotting, not this! I #8217;d been on the combo pill for 9 years and completely forgot what periods could be like. So much blood! The cramps! UGHHH
How the hell are you supposed to analyze CM when a LOT of sex is being had? It seems nearly impossible to tell which body fluids are yours and which are not. Asking for a friend, of course.

I #8217;m about 4 weeks off of HBC, and during the first week I had MASSIVE mood swings and was very weepy. After that it seemed to calm down significantly, but everyone is different. I really hope you start feeling more like yourself soon!

Hubs and I hadn #8217;t seen each other for months (thanks, work and pandemic!) so we #8217;re basically acting like hormonal teenagers and are all over each other lol. I #8217;m temping but this is my first cycle post-HBC so I have honestly no clue what #8217;s going on with myself or what to expect.

WRITING.TITLE: Conceiving after continuous-use method of combo pill
WRITING.TEXT: I used the #8220;question #8221; flair because I don #8217;t know how else to categorize this lol. Also, I haven #8217;t been able to find information about this particular question. Background first: I had been on the combo pill for 9 years. The first 7.5 years I took 0.8mg norethindrone/25mcg ethinyl estradiol (24/4), the last 1.5 years it #8217;s been 0.15 levonorgestrel/30mcg ethinyl estradiol (21/7), if that #8217;s relevant. When I temporarily moved to another country for work, the nurse prescribed me the latter of the two because a pill with the first formulation wasn #8217;t available. After about 6 months, I switched from an antidepressant and started taking Lamictal off-label instead for my depression/anxiety. At that point, the gynecological nurse I #8217;d been seeing told me to skip the sugar pills because of an interaction between the two drugs, which basically causes the Lamictal level to decrease in your bloodstream, so taking the placebo pills could cause a potentially dangerous spike of Lamictal. Side note: Lamictal has been shown to make HBC less effective, but I #8217;d never had even a pregnancy scare since starting it. I stopped taking HBC about 4ish weeks ago (bad memory, thanks ADHD) under careful direction from my doctor, who monitored me for the first few days to make sure I wasn #8217;t having the potential problems like toxicity that could be caused by the aforementioned interactions. Obviously, I #8217;m fine on that front. Anyway, there #8217;s the background, so onto the question: Does continuous-use HBC affect your chances of conceiving within a certain time frame, as compared to taking it in the #8220;normal #8221; way? I know that HBC does not permanently affect your fertility in the long haul, but your hormones regulating themselves can take a while etc blah blah blah. I #8217;d imagine though that with continuous use the endometrium would be harder to build back up, and ovulation might take longer to resume since your body isn #8217;t used to any sort of withdrawal. But maybe the opposite is true? That your body is suddenly like #8220;BAM those hormones are gone for real let #8217;s get a move on #8221;?? My body seems to have followed the expected course of stopping HBC, for the record. Like I said, I literally can #8217;t find anything about this, so advice/information/experience is much appreciated!

Echoing a lot of what u/goldbehold said - Your desire to have a child and care about their wellbeing shows your ability to rise to the challenge of motherhood when the time comes. You should probably consult a doctor or counselor about your concerns. Genetic health testing could also be helpful to see how hereditary your eczema is. That way, you don #8217;t have to ruminate on that specific issue and you have a better idea one way or another of the possibility of you passing it on to your child. Just spitballing here. Again, your care and concern shows you #8217;re a considerate person and capable of being there for your child regardless of their health. That #8217;s the most important aspect of being a good parent, imo.

I #8217;m glad someone else is on the same page and has had similar difficulty finding relevant information lol, makes me feel like I #8217;m not totally incompetent :P I guess only time will tell what happens! If I have over 3 cycles with no luck I #8217;m probably gonna shell out the money for the full/premium FF app just to get a better idea of what #8217;s going on

From my understanding you start counting your cycle from when you first get your withdrawal #8220;period #8221; after stopping, in which case I #8217;m on CD16. I #8217;ve also read that you can get pregnant after stopping HBC and before getting your actual period. I guess we #8217;ll see in about 2 weeks #8217; time whether it #8217;s regular or not yet!
Thanks for the info! I #8217;ll give that spreadsheet a closer look when I #8217;m home with my laptop
DH and I have been rewatching The Last Kingdom, I highly recommend :)
FF says I am 3DPO and even though this is my first cycle of trying I #8217;m already going nuts waiting.
Yeah, I think the fact that it #8217;s my first TWW doesn #8217;t help haha. I appreciate the crossed fingers!!
Haha what a wild coincidence. Fingers crossed for unicornhood for both of us, but I #8217;m personally trying to not keep my expectations too high haha

Going through some really hard personal issues unrelated to TTC and my husband has been extremely supportive throughout it all. He also sat down and played my favorite Rachmaninov piece on the piano for me. He #8217;s my rock, as cliche as that sounds.

Lucky! It #8217;s rainy and chilly where I am, so I #8217;m inside avoiding that. My job is kind of unique and I currently don #8217;t have any projects so I #8217;ve been hanging out at home and trying not to go crazy. Lots of Netflix and video games. Also, I #8217;ve ALWAYS wanted to go to Ireland! It looks gorgeous and the history/folklore is amazing

I #8217;m 3DPO too and have ADHD, which has caused me to hyperfocus on TTC and testing. I #8217;m VERY impatient but have been successfully distracting myself to a certain extent. If you have a good book or video game or have been watching a really engaging show, I recommend using those as much as possible during your free time.

Hope you continue to enjoy sunshine for a few days before the rains inevitably return, knowing the North Atlantic :P Been rewatching The Last Kingdom lately and, uh well, lots of other shows that we had to pirate lmao.

Same exact boat here re: first cycle off birth control after withdrawal bleeding and before actual first menstrual period. There were some issues with time zones/travel so I wasn #8217;t temping SUPER reliably... but I got a crosshairs too, albeit one with a dotted line. I got EWCM a few days after the estimated O day. My body is a mystery right now, but hey, fingers crossed for both of us!
Trying to decide if I should test today (10DPO) or wait a few days because HPTs are not cheap here

I have ADHD (primarily inattentive type), GAD, AND depression (dysthymia). I #8217;m on my first cycle of trying to conceive and am currently waiting to test. I am also curious as to how others have coped with having MH issues while TTC. But do know you #8217;re far from alone, OP.

I mean I can get a pack of two that you can use up to 5 days before your period for around $11 but I don #8217;t know almost anything about the brand or quality haha. Might be smart to at least wait a few days.

I #8217;m 10DPO and chomping at the bit to test! This wait is so difficult. The past week I #8217;ve been trying to distract myself by playing video games and watching TV with my husband, which has helped a lot. Best of luck to you too, both with dealing with the TWW and for a BFP sooner rather than later!

Kind of a weird one: Husband and I both have ADHD which means any kids will probably inherit that, since it #8217;s very hereditary. I #8217;m looking forward to being able to understand and support them and to get them an early diagnosis/treatment (if applicable) since my husband and I both got diagnosed as adults. School would have been much easier for me if I had the diagnosis, but being able to encourage and sympathize with my child about sharing the same condition will be really beneficial for all of us.

I #8217;m somewhere between 10 and 14 DPO (not exactly sure but FF estimated 14). I had loads of EWCM on what was supposed to be my 4PDO and very little before that, so I #8217;m not sure. Anyway, I bought a two-pack of #8220;early #8221; tests and got a BFN yesterday afternoon when I took one of them. I know you get better results in the morning but there #8217;s also the possibility I took it too early, and of course the likelihood that I #8217;m NOT pregnant. I #8217;m trying to hold off a few days before doing the second test, as AF is theoretically due tomorrow. Blahhhh.

Turns out I #8217;m not a one-cycle unicorn! I know there are people who have been trying way longer than me so I feel guilty for feeling so sad about it. I #8217;m just gonna cry it out and eat some junk food later.

CD2, first #8220;true period #8221; after stopping birth control. I am crying at everything. I cried at a song that I like even though it isn #8217;t sad. I cried because my husband moved the trash can in the bathroom closer to the toilet. Who knows what else today will have in store? Interestingly, my first cycle off the pill (including withdrawal bleeding) was exactly 28 days long and I ovulated on CD14. I #8217;m hoping that continues to be a trend.

Yep (well kind of), it #8217;s not fun or easy. I have a job that makes me have to travel away - sometimes abroad - for long periods at somewhat short notice and we #8217;d been wanting to try for a while but physically couldn #8217;t because of distance/covid travel issues. But now I #8217;m home with no projects to travel for that I know of, and as winter approaches there will be fewer. But come spring I #8217;ll be traveling again, assuming I #8217;m not on maternal leave. We #8217;re early in the process, as you can tell by my flair, but we #8217;re definitely going to have months where we won #8217;t be able to try at all because of distance.

That is extremely bizarre of her to announce to a group of people she doesn #8217;t even know, especially in the context of a drug use/rehabilitation course??? I understand being happy about being pregnant but wtf. Totally sympathize with your anger about it too. Good thing she was only a guest lecturer and the course is over!

My first cycle off the combo pill was a perfect 28 days with ovulation at CD14. I #8217;m on CD50 of my second cycle now with no crosshairs or period in sight, just creamy CM. Got a BFN last cycle, two weeks ago, and will be testing again on Thursday. I was so optimistic last time that it would be a BFP, and now I #8217;m just frustrated that my hormones aren #8217;t regulating properly.
CD51 and I just want AF to show up so I know my hormones aren #8217;t 100% royally fucked after years of HBC. I didn #8217;t think I #8217;d ever want to see AF during this process!

This is gonna be one of those that will be hard to read for some folks and I know my luck is insane and I have not been the least bit diligent in tracking stuff... Cycle: 2 Age + Partner #8217;s age: I #8217;m 28, he #8217;s 36 Typical cycle length: #175;\\\_( #12484;)\_/ #175; This is my second cycle off birth control. The first was 28 days and the second was like 42ish. Ovulation cycle day: Unknown, I was not temping or anything but judging by my tests it must have been around CD35? CD of positive test: CD52 Tracking methods/app used: Used FF/temping religiously last cycle and some for the beginning of this cycle. I thought I was out this round after getting two BFNs so I had stopped tracking... Relevant days of spermination/method: We were having sex every single day so I guess it was like throwing noodles at a wall and hoping something sticks. Health conditions: We both have ADHD and a few common/comorbid things like depression/anxiety, all being managed Supplements and medications (yours and/or your partner #8217;s): There are a LOT, nothing specifically fertility-related other than prenatal vitamins Birth control history: I was on the combo pill from 2011 until this past July. Lineporn: [Here](https://imgur.com/a/34YSfgL) - I was freaking out when I took the photo, wish I had gotten a better one Symptom spotting: I #8217;ve been much hungrier than usual, also sleeping poorly despite being very tired etc at the end of the day. My breasts have also been tender and, weirdly, my nose has been congested (which is a symptom sometimes!). Oh, and I #8217;ve been peeing a lot more. But the past 2-3 days in particular I #8217;ve been experiencing some weird, localized cramping that doesn #8217;t really hurt too much, it #8217;s kind of a pulling/tensing feeling and now that I #8217;ve gotten my BFP I #8217;m sort of relishing in that sensation. Other: Oh my god I can #8217;t believe I got pregnant my second cycle off birth control. I was adopted at birth so this is especially strange in the most wonderful way. I spent most of my life not knowing a single biological relative; this past February I connected with a half-sister but that #8217;s it. Anyway, like I said, I really thought I was out until the next cycle so when I tested last night as a #8220;every two weeks #8221; thing I was totally bowled over when a second line appeared almost instantly. I legitimately almost fainted from shock. My husband and I are still getting over the shock but we are utterly thrilled and know we have a lot of work ahead of us. I feel kind of a vague guilt when I think about how many people here have been trying for months/years and I feel like I won the 2nd place lottery prize. You all deserve to be pregnant and have a baby too, so I #8217;m especially sending love to all of you who have had to be *very* patient in your journey. PS: holy shit I #8217;m gonna be a mom. There #8217;s gonna be a little human who needs me. PPS: holy shit my husband #8217;s gonna be a dad. He #8217;s gonna be a fucking awesome dad.
Oh shit, my little guy has to have two arms! Thanks bot.

WRITING.TITLE: CD52/?DPO. SureSign brand. Holy shit I #8217;m pregnant on my second cycle off birth control. I could cry.

WRITING.TEXT: I tested negative on both CD28 and CD38 so I definitely had an abnormally long cycle. I was reeeeally not expecting a BFP yesterday, and yet, here we are. Life... finds a way
Thank you!! I #8217;m so excited
Thank you!!
Thank you!! I #8217;m still totally gobsmacked
Thank you! :D

We told my husband #8217;s parents that they were going to be grandparents last night and they were completely over the moon. His dad has wanted to be a grandfather for like 10 years and his reaction was about the cutest thing I #8217;ve ever seen. In other news I #8217;m queasy and bloated. Food generally sounds unappealing but I just keep eating??

WRITING.TITLE: Telling parents/timing difficulties
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m about 5 weeks pregnant, but I #8217;m not totally sure because I didn #8217;t track my cycle/temp this time and it was an unusually long cycle. Tested negative two Thursdays ago and then tested positive this most recent Thursday (then again on Sunday). My husband are from two different countries and are living in his country. Due to travel restrictions and health reasons, my parents can #8217;t come here, and there #8217;s currently a bad second wave of the pandemic. I will only be able to tell them #8220;electronically #8221;. My husband and I told his parents and sisters last night, who were absolutely giddy to learn they were gonna be grandparents/aunts. They also are keeping things on the DL for the rest of the first trimester. I know I should tell my parents soon too, but my family situation is a little complicated for the time being. My mother, whom I love, can be extremely overbearing. Anytime I have some sort of project/stress/whatever going on she gets neurotic and hovers and asks me a billion questions. On top of that, her mother (that I don #8217;t have any contact with due to her treating me abusively) currently has aggressive cancer, and my mom and her siblings are with her in another city for a week while she gets surgery. My parents are still together, and while my dad is doing fine and is back home I don #8217;t want to tell just him. My mom is already very stressed and I don #8217;t want to bring out her neuroticism even further by telling her that her daughter is pregnant. Plus, for related and unrelated reasons, I #8217;M stressed and don #8217;t want to be consumed by it. Has anyone had to break the news at a bad time in a family member #8217;s life, and/or to an extremely overbearing family member? I definitely need some advice!

Does anyone else get served food, think #8220;I #8217;m not really hungry #8221;/ #8220;that doesn #8217;t look appealing #8221;, then proceed to horf down the entire meal? Because I #8217;ve been doing that...
